etymologies: mid 16th century: from Latin postscriptum, neuter past participle (used as a noun) of postscribere ‘write under, add’, from post ‘after, later’ + scribere ‘write’

definitions: an additional remark at the end of a letter, after the signature and introduced by “P.S.”
shortDefinitions: additional remark at end of letter

definitions: an additional statement or action that provides further information on or a sequel to something

examples.text: as a postscript to this, Paul did finally marry

shortDefinitions: extra piece of information about event that is added after it has happened
